data.text:
It was very quiet when I visited on a weekday at lunchtime.

Food was very good and reasonably priced. 2 meals and drinks for under £10. Service and staff were polite, attentive and courteous.

It is primarily a bar and I expect it is far busier in the evening and especially at weekends.

Whilst it was clean, the only negative was that the floors were that sticky from spilt drinks that it felt like wading through a film of treacle.

This seems like any other Revs bar. Popular at night and a good place for a cheap lunch.

I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this place.

data.text:
Wish I could put 0 stars!
Me and my Partner went to Revolutions Wilmslow for New Year’s Eve.
He went in to the bathroom as he was feeling unwell, 3 bouncers forced the door open on him which ran over his big toe and has caused it to bleed and bruise and bashed his knee which is bruising. The 3 bouncers then proceeded to drag him up and all 3 had hold of him dragging him out. Which has resulted in bruising under his arm from where he was being held by a bouncer. I was sober at the time and my partner was not putting up a fight and was not reluctant when he was being escorted out. It did not need all 3 bouncers to forcibly remove him. It felt as if they were all removing him for the fun of it. I asked what they were doing and they told me to leave them to it. I explained I was with him. I felt there was a lack of care and respect from them and I’m really disappointed in how it was all handled, it was quite distressing to watch. I understand they have a duty of care to those who use the bar, however my partner was not abusive or non-compliant and no care was shown to the both of us. This experience has now made me very uncomfortable and I do not feel safe going out!

I have already written an email complaint on Sunday and I have had no response.
data.name: Molly James
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Good Morning Molly,

First let me apologise for the delayed response as the business has been closed until today after NYE

Our reports from the incident on the evening is that your partner was not replying to the DS after our toilet attendant reported him on the floor in the cubicle. Any incident of this nature is extremely serious and required the DS to unlock the door and gain access due to a lack of reply. In this situation we must act fast and expect the worst as I am sure you will understand. I apologise if you feel this was not required but as you are aware he is under our duty of care whilst in the venue. 

Door staff then got him to his feet and walked him to the front door and provided him with a complimentary bottle of water. After reviewing the footage myself I can see he held up and gently walked to the front door.

I apologise if you feel the door staff's reply was short or lacked patience. With the venue being so busy on NYE it is important that they resolve issues promptly so they can return to their set locations and oversee the venue to spot any other potential issues or dangers.

I hope you can give us another chance to regain your trust and join the many hundreds who join us every week to enjoy drinks and food in a fun and safe environment.

If you wish to discuss this any further please don't hesitate to get in touch

Kind Regards,
Matthew Hodges
General Manager

data.text: Ordered food online. Delivery time was 45 minutes late, food when arrived was all over the place and an absolute mess. Chips were stone cold and sweaty. Considering the price I paid the quality did not match. Very disappointing and will not be ordering again over Deliveroo.
data.name: Elizabeth Rawlinson
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Good Afternoon Elizabeth,

Firstly I am extremely sorry your Deliveroo experience with us this afternoon. I have investigated this from my side and can see that this particular order was failed to be collected by Deliveroo and not fulfilled from them to the correct standard. This would explain the cold items. The presentation of the food is possibly also damaged / ruined in transit

Please contact Deliveroo as I am sure they will process you a full refund on this order, the delay on collection and delivery will be on their records

Kind Regards,
Matthew Hodges
General Manager

data.text: Nice place but very expensive. £6 for a lager shandy. Edit.. my mistake as my banking app rounded up to £6. The actual price was 5.35 which is still too expensive for a shandy. Whether the staff remembers serving one or not
data.name: David Gibbons
data.responseFromOwnerText: Hi David.  This is an unusual one, as our lager shandy is only £4.20. I have checked with the team that worked the day you left this review and none of them can remember serving a shandy.  If you bring a receipt in showing that we have in fact charged you £6 for a shandy we will very quickly and quickly amend this for you!  Many Thanks. Team Wilmslow.

data.text: Such a shame the toilets let it down!

data.responseFromOwnerText: Hi Jayne.   We're sorry to see you only left a 2* review.  We are doing everything we can to keep on top of the toilet maintenance, as it's something we encounter often. Fixing toilet seats is one of our weekly tasks as the late night trade takes it toll on them!  We hope to see you again soon. Team Wilmslow.

data.text:
This has been my regular for the last 12 years. Revs Wilmslow is a guaranteed GOOD time, emphasis on guaranteed.

The trade off being though, that it’s rare you’ll have a GREAT time here though. You’ll probably have to travel beyond Wilmslow for that honestly.

So it’s a solid 4 out of 5 from me.

data.text: We were celebrating one of my Friends  birthday and decided to spent it here a couple of us met up before hand around 8 of us and had a couple of drinks, I had 4 Budweisers to be precise we get the the bar and some of us needed cash so split up everyone got into the bar and as me and another friend approached I brought out my ID and passed it to a bouncer who instantly gave it back and told me to look at him, which I did he asked how many I’ve had which I replied “4 Budweisers mate ,£3.50 from Asda, as a joke he then moved me aside and said you need to wait out here for 10 minutes, then you can come in, so I waited in the cold on my own, I sat waiting for the ten minutes and spotted another group of friends that I  knew who we’re aloud straight in when they obviously had a lot to drink i then approached the bouncer after standing on my own in the cold for about 15 minutes trying to get hold of everyone inside as I wasn’t aloud to go in and tell them that I didn’t get in and without a phone couldn’t really do much, after 2 more groups of mainly drunk lads were aloud to enter I walk back to the entrance as I go to the bouncer he stands in my way and shakes his head, I asked why I wasn’t aloud in and wasn’t give a reason and wasn’t aloud to tell my mates I would have to leave after only just getting there, being the bigger man I walked away and got in a taxi, just think it was quite rude and unprofessional I don’t mind not getting in to be honest fair enough I did nothing wrong but I’m not one to argue especially on my own but it was the fact I wasn’t given a reason and made to stand in the cold with no contact with anyone inside, wouldn’t recommend this bar to anyone anymore after this incident
data.name: J
data.responseFromOwnerText: Hi Jake  Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review.  While we appreciate you are unhappy at the way you feel you were treated we must make it clear that both Revolution Bars Group and the Door Supervisor teams we employee are bound by a duty of care to monitor and prevent intoxicated guests from access to more alcohol. On this occasion it was deemed that you were too intoxicated to enter the venue.  We understand your frustration at not being informed of this from the start, and this feedback will be delivered to our door teams in order to improve moving forward.  Kind regards  Team Wilmslow
